Posts.Content: Hi Jo666 I was advised to use simple showe gel, shampoo all range of simple products as these were the best for people having chemo. You can try and if it works then fine. I love the simple range seems to work for me
Posts.Title: Shampoo

Posts.Content: Hi Jo I had to have my fluid asperated and you need to ask for this as well. My drain was removed the morning after surgery and it should not have been.  The seventh time of asperating finally it has gone never to return. The BCN's did six of them over 200mls each time last one done by prof brown when I was due a scan got 365 MLS no scan done but fluid all gone. Might be worth you asking to be asperated as it should not be swishing around  Raegan
Posts.Title: Hooray drain finally removed

Posts.Content: Hi Rach1969 Try the simple range my BCN advised me to try this and there are no additives nothing it is all natural. The range is shower gel, shampoo, soap, moisturiser and other creams. Hope you feel better soon  Raegan
Posts.Title: Dry, flaky, itch scalp since chemo.

Posts.Content: Hi Deirdre I have had my aeronautical aspirated six times since mastectomy in Jan 24th 2017. Now it is exactly the same as yours I saw my BCN last week about it and advice was to massage for about two months. She said it is like a honeycomb, and the liquid has congeald. My skin is red with massaging as it is pretty big,not my breast haha the seroma, but I will do as they ask for six weeks if it ain't going down two weeks will not make any difference. Everyone is different though yours may just sort itself out. Don't worry too much if it was anything they would give you a Scan
Posts.Title: Seroma advice please

Posts.Content: Hi Deirdre I hate predictive text sorry the word should be seroma
Posts.Title: Seroma advice please

Posts.Content: Hi ScardofPN I get these but hosp say it is my nerve endings starting to work after mastectomy. And I thought surely not but now it is stabbing pains on breast or where it used to be. But it is pretty scary when it happens.  Hope yours is not too bad whatever it is causing it.  Raegan
Posts.Title: Stabbing pains Docetaxel + Herceptin

Posts.Content: I am also having aches and pains in legs for a while I had face ache dont laugh honestly I did. I am on letrozole and risedronate. Plus the sweats are awful my clothes are soaking through this is happening three or four times per day and sleep I could sleep for Britain just now I always seem tired.  On on a lighter not no more face ache haha
Posts.Title: Aches and pains ....... still!!!

Posts.Content: Hi stevie Q I am on letrezole and have been since March the make I am on is accord, I did begin with sore joints and bones, but that cleared up the only thing I have at the moment is tiredness I could sleep for Britain. I still need to get my wound asperated this has been seventh time,since op in January. I have a scan on Wednesday to see if it is anything else underlying but last asperation was five weeks ago and it is needing done again. To help with trying to lower oestrogen I am taking pumpkin seed capsules . Porridge with fruit, lots of fruit and green veg as mine is her2+   Hope some of this helps
Posts.Title: Letrozole - side effects and supplements

Posts.Content: Hi  I had left macrectomy in Jan 2017. I was given the gel prothesis from the hospital looked online they are between 110.00 and 140 ish. I have a great prothesis does not move at all the softie I was given slipped but not the gel one. I have non wired bra from Asda 8.00 Lacey one, they do not have much choice but the best bra I have found is online from company who only do prothesis bras they range from 24.00 upwards, it is amoena.co.uk but worth every penny.  Hope this helps Raegan
Posts.Title: Bra problem

Posts.Content: Go to website for amoema I got my sports bra there it was 26.00 but worth every penny it is very comfortable but I did not get reconstruction but it is still a bra that is normal sports one
Posts.Title: Post surgery sports bras

Posts.Content: Hi all I had DCIS stage 3 her2 and her+ in left breast I was told nothing to worry about no cancer but we have to remove your left breast no further treatment will be needed had mastectomy only to be told about stage 3 and above info. Then told get chemo then in tablets for five years. Then chemo taken away felt like all the rugs been pulled from under me. Now on letrezole and risedronate, but have swelling above my wound BCN thinks it is fluid thT has congealed even although I had my wound aspirated five times, so have to massage as much as I can. Have done this and nothing has changed still there, now need to go for a scan, plus had a wee lump u see right arm she said get antibiotics which I have done still there that also needs looked at now. I do not have any appointments to see oncologist nor any dr till my first mammagram after op which is not till December, can I ask if I can have mammagram before this or would it be best to pay privately for one as I cannot wait till Dec now that chemo not offered I have the chance of it coming back elsewhere. I know I should not think like this but any thing different with my breast or wound is driving me mad with these thoughts. Any help would be appreciated
Posts.Title: Everything

Posts.Content: Hi Jo Thanks I have not had reconstruction just the mastectomy. I will call today for an appointment with BCN. Thanks for your help it is appreciated xx
Posts.Title: Everything

Posts.Content: Hi chloecat45 Thanks for your reply I will call hosp tomorrow and let you know what happens  Thanks again xxx
Posts.Title: Everything

Posts.Content: Hi all Called BCN today got an appointment Thursday so hopefully will ha e good news. Thanks to you all for your help and support  Raegan
Posts.Title: Everything

Posts.Content: Hi all I got a Nicola jane prothesis blue gel,  but tell you what it is the best I have had so far I have three just now and this one is the best says it is  for sports and swimming but loads wear them as normal prothesis and they are only 49.99, great value, used for a week daily and on an occasion I forgot I had no breast removed so that can’t be bad thing
Posts.Title: Post surgery bra sale online M&S

Posts.Content: Hi Jill try puffin insurance we booked with them last year and again we have booked they have bronze, silver and gold insurance we took out silver for this year's trip
Posts.Title: Travel Insurance categories (secondary cancer or not?)

Posts.Content: Hi Undergroundbarbie I feel exactly the same read the literature thought fab I will have the best support and they eould be there for me after mastectomy. What a huge disappointment not one call nothing no sympathy nothing. I have now had 8 aspiration to my would with between 180 mls to 365 Mls each time.  Also have lymphodema which surgeon knew nothing about or so he said, yet it is as a result of him damaging my nodes during the operation. My brother passed away in jan 2016 he said Macmillan did absolutely nothing for him, no help about finances, treatment in fact no nursss came near him. He was 62 so young nowadays I said I cannot believe that they would treT a patient like this how wrong I was I am being treated exactly the same, not the same area his was Edinburgh mine is dundee so cannot day it is same area. Even after saying nodes damaged by surgeon not a dickie bird you would think that would make it more important, as surgeon afraid I would sue as now have lymphodema for life as chronic. I would never sue over this accidents do happen but you would think this would make a difference to them keeping in touch not at all do different from what you see on tv and in leaflets . Let’s hope they are not all like this
Posts.Title: Post op disappointment

Posts.Content: Hi Peanut11 I was the same both positive and as it was not in one place but spread over 75mm I had to have mastectomy of left breast. No treatment other than letrezole and risedronate for 5 years just had anniversary mammogram no results yet but I am feeling very good about it and I will be fine.  Ask many questions, write them down as you always forget and this helps. Sending hugs we are all with you  Xx
Posts.Title: Her2 and ER positive
